comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: See: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00E12F73F5A15738... 250,000 in Tie-up at Morning Rush Hour; Affects Whole City Short Circuit Starts Fire Three Packed Trains Stalled at 55th St. and Broadway Near Flames New York Times January 7, 1915 The worst accident in the history of the New York subways occurred yesterday morning, when one woman was killed and 210 persons weer overcome by smoke or trampled upon. Three crowded downtown trains weer stalled at 8:02 o'clock between the Columbus Circle and Fiftieth Street station by a short circuit which set fire to the insulation of electric wires and filled the tunnel with a dense acrid smoke.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Most of the buildings are now gone, with the exception of the Woodward (now Dream) Hotel, but the access grates to the subway (the only exit for the 250 trapped passengers) are still there. maps.google.com/maps?q=1261+broadway+new+york&hl=en&a...

comment.author: 70964530@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'd like to invite you to submit your photo to Fire, Rescue, Emergency and EMS HiQ . FREEHQ contains the most dramatic, interesting, rare, creative and high quality (HQ) photos related to fire, rescue, and emergency services, by land, sea, or air on flickr; as well as the occasional semi-related photo from outside the proverbial box. Regards, TomBk Admin FREEHQ
